newsitem.title: GERMANY: Rexrodt confident Germany to meet EMU target.
newsitem.headline: Rexrodt confident Germany to meet EMU target.

text.p: Economics Minister Guenter Rexrodt said on Friday he is confident that Germany will succeed in its efforts to rein in budget deficits in time to qualify for European economic and monetary union (EMU).

"I am very convinced that we will meet the deficit criterion, which will require above all tenacity and convergence," Rexrodt told German Radio before leaving for the Group of Seven economic summit in Denver.

The Maastricht treaty on monetary union requires EMU participants to limit budget deficits to three percent of Gross Domestic Product and public debt to 60 percent. There are also targets on inflation and other economic indicators.
Rexrodt added that the euro could only be introduced if a core of European Union members met these criteria, saying that would ensure that the euro was a strong currency.
Commenting on the German economy, he said: "Germany is progressing well," adding that the current economic development was "acceptable".
